data.text:
Primary care plays a pivotal role in healthcare systems as the first point of access to care. According to many surveys across Canada, nearly one in ten (nine percent) have reported not having a regular medical doctor, and many more people said they had problems accessing primary care. Even if patients manage to secure an appointment with a doctor, they often face another challenge: overbooked physicians. Doctors who are overwhelmed with a high volume of patients may find it challenging to provide the quality of care and attention that each individual deserves. There is a solution to balancing supply of healthcare services with demand, improving access to care and creating a better work environment for healthcare professionals. Read more: https://lnkd.in/guk8k2bg #tpgdifference #healthcareprofessionals #primarycare #healthcaremanagement

I am excited to announce that I have officially achieved my Lean Six Sigma Black Belt Certification through MoreSteam! This journey has been challenging and quite rewarding. I would like to thank everyone who helped and supported me at The Poirier Group. Special thanks to the project teams and colleagues who were always ready to lend a hand and offer insights. A huge thank you to Scott Sink and Jared Frederici for your guidance over the last year. Your mentorship has been invaluable in helping me reach this milestone. These learnings will enable me to make a real difference by driving continuous improvement and operational excellence in every organization I get to work with. I'm genuinely excited about the new opportunities and challenges that lie ahead!

Some members of our Healthcare Consulting team at work finalizing the modules to support Long-Term Care homes in becoming Centers of Excellence. Our model reduces staff non-value-added work burden to allow for increased direct resident care time. Reach out to discuss our model, and we will share our roadmap to building higher-value resident care and staff engagement. Let's make a difference, one step at a time. According to a Forbes article (2015), 31% of CEOs are fired because they canâ€™t lead change. This is often the result of a highly directive and top-down approach. In today's fast-paced change world, the best way to lead through change is through a collaborative approach that involves and informs employees of what is changing and why. What should leaders do to ensure change is accepted and adopted by their organizations? To help leaders, we have created a simple "Do and Don't" list for your next change initiative.
